title: Berkeley No. 38
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney M. Feldman
provenance_text:
Richard Diebenkorn [1922-1993], Berkeley, CA, until December 1955 [1]; Mr. [1912-1990] and Mrs. Sidney M. Feldman (Sylvia Bernstein Feldman) [?-1992], Pittsburgh, PA, December 1955 until May 1964 [2]; gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, May 1964 [3].

Notes:
[1]. The painting was no. 79 (illustrated, plate 24) in "The 1955 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Painting" held at Carnegie Institute, October-December 1955. 
[2]. Mr. Feldman purchased the painting from the International for $650 on December 5, 1955.
[3]. The donors retained life interest in the painting (see Deed of Gift, dated May 20, 1964, in donor file.)  Mr. and Mrs. Feldman subsequently moved to Bal Harbour, FL. Mr. Feldman died in February 1990 and Mrs. Feldman in November 1992. The painting was received at the museum from her estate in February 1993.
